Doc: Describes the FX fixing schedule, a single continuous observation period which follows the applicable business day schedule for the quoted rate source.

Source.Contents:
/#
   Describes the FX fixing schedule, a single continuous observation period which follows the applicable business day schedule for the quoted rate source.
 #/
record FpML5.recordkeeping.FxFixingScheduleSimple {
  # The start of the period over which observations are made to determine whether a trigger has occurred.
  startDate : date

  # The end of the period over which observations are made to determine whether a trigger event has occurred.
  endDate : date

  # Specifies whether the schedule follows the business or calendar days.
  dayType : string

  # A pointer style reference to a set of financial business centers defined elsewhere in the document. This set of business centers is used to determine whether a particular day is a business day or not.
  businessCentersReference : FpML5.recordkeeping.BusinessCentersReference

  businessCenters : FpML5.recordkeeping.BusinessCenters

  # An explicit list of dates in the schedule. For documentation purpose only.
  fixingDate : date?

}

startDate.Doc: The start of the period over which observations are made to determine whether a trigger has occurred.
startDate.Name: startDate

endDate.Doc: The end of the period over which observations are made to determine whether a trigger event has occurred.
endDate.Name: endDate

dayType.Doc: Specifies whether the schedule follows the business or calendar days.
dayType.Name: dayType

businessCentersReference.Doc: A pointer style reference to a set of financial business centers defined elsewhere in the document. This set of business centers is used to determine whether a particular day is a business day or not.
businessCentersReference.Name: businessCentersReference

fixingDate.Doc: An explicit list of dates in the schedule. For documentation purpose only.
fixingDate.Name: fixingDate
